kXML contains a complete and consistent API for "clean" XML corresponding to the Common XML recommendations by Simon St.Laurent etal.

See:
          Description

Packages
org.kxml  
org.kxml.io  
org.kxml.kdom This package is optional.
org.kxml.parser  
org.kxml.wap  

 

kXML contains a complete and consistent API for "clean" XML corresponding to the Common XML recommendations by Simon St.Laurent etal. It is intended for restricted environments like the PDAs or embedded systems

The main difference to other XML APIs is that it contains only limited support for concepts declared dangerous in the Common XML document, leading to a lean and understandable API.

Some features are:

  • WBXML / WML support
  • Namespace prefix collision detection
  • KVM compatibility
  • Pull-based "reader"-like parsing enabling recursive descend and modularity
